TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TreeNodeBindingCollection extends System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection
Public NotInheritable Class TreeNodeBindingCollection Inherits StateManagedCollection
public ref class TreeNodeBindingCollection sealed : System::Web::UI::StateManagedCollection

summary.span: 表示 控件中 对象的集合。

span.span: Represents a collection of objects in the control.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 类用于存储和管理控件中对象的集合。 The class is used to store and manage a collection of objects in the control. 控件使用类作为其属性。 The control uses the class for its property. 属性包含的对象定义数据项和它所绑定到的节点之间的关系。The property contains objects that define the relationship between a data item and the node that it is binding to. 绑定到数据源 (其中每个数据项都包含多个属性) 时, 默认情况下, 节点将显示数据项的`ToString`方法返回的值。When binding to a data source where each data item contains multiple properties (such as an XML element with several attributes), a node displays the value that is returned by the `ToString` method of the data item, by default. 对于 XML 元素, 该节点将显示元素名称, 该名称显示树的基础结构, 但在其他情况下不起作用。In the case of an XML element, the node displays the element name, which shows the underlying structure of the tree but is not very useful otherwise. 可以通过指定树节点绑定将节点绑定到特定数据项属性。You can bind a node to a specific data item property by specifying tree node bindings. 尽管可以通过编程方式填充该集合, 但通常以声明方式进行设置。Although the collection can be programmatically populated, it is usually set declaratively. 若要以声明方式设置树节点绑定:To set the tree node bindings declaratively: 1. 在控件的开始``和结束标记之间嵌套开始和结束标记。Nest opening and closing `` tags between the opening and closing tags of the control. 2. 在``要指定的每个树``节点绑定的开始标记和结束标记之间放置元素。Place `` elements between the opening and closing `` tags for each tree node binding that you want to specify. 可以通过添加和删除对象以编程方式管理。You can programmatically manage a by adding and removing objects. 若要将对象添加到集合, 请使用或方法。To add a object to the collection, use the or method. 若要从集合中删除节点, 请使用、或方法。To remove nodes from the collection, use the , , or method. 类支持多种方法来访问集合中的项:The class supports several ways to access the items in the collection: - 使用索引器在特定的从零开始的索引处直接检索对象。 Use the indexer to retrieve a object directly at a specific zero-based index. - 使用方法可创建一个可用于循环访问集合的枚举器。Use the method to create an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection. ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个代码示例演示如何以声明方式填充对象。The first code example demonstrates how to populate a object declaratively. 第二个代码示例演示如何以编程方式填充对象。The second code example demonstrates how to populate a object programmatically. 下面的代码示例演示如何以声明方式填充对象。The following code example demonstrates how to populate a object declaratively. 若要使此示例正常工作, 必须将位于此部分末尾的 XML 数据复制到名为 books.xml 的文件中。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. [!code-aspx-csharp[TreeViewXml#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewXml/CS/treeviewxmlcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeViewXml#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewXml/VB/treeviewxmlvb.aspx#1)] 下面的代码示例演示如何以编程方式填充对象。The following code example demonstrates how to populate a object programmatically. 若要使此示例正常工作, 必须将位于此部分末尾的示例 XML 数据复制到名为 books.xml 的文件中。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the sample XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. [!code-aspx-csharp[TreeViewCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewCtor/CS/treeviewctorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeViewCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewCtor/VB/treeviewctorvb.aspx#1)] 下面是上述代码示例的 XML 数据。The following is the XML data for the preceding code examples. ```
```

remarks.format:
## Remarks 使用方法将指定的对象追加到对象的末尾。 Use the method to append the specified object to the end of the object. 作为替代方法, 可以使用方法将对象插入到特定索引处的中。As an alternative, you can insert a object in the at a specific index using the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法以编程方式将新对象添加到对象。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to add a new object programmatically to a object. 若要使此示例正常工作, 必须将位于此部分末尾的 XML 数据复制到名为 books.xml 的文件中。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. [!code-aspx-csharp[TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd/CS/treenodebindingcollectionaddcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd/VB/treenodebindingcollectionaddvb.aspx#1)] 下面是上述代码示例的 XML 数据。The following is the XML data for the preceding code example. ```
```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法可确定对象中 是否包含对象。 Use the method to determine whether a object is contained in the object. 此方法通常用于在执行任务之前测试对象是否存在, 例如, 在集合中添加或删除。This method is commonly used to test for the existence of a object before performing a task, such as adding or removing a from the collection.

span.span: Copies all the items from the object to a compatible one-dimensional array of objects, starting at the specified index in the target array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法将对象的内容复制到中`bindingArray`。 Use the method to copy the contents of the object into `bindingArray`. 从开始`index`复制项。Items are copied starting at `index`. 然后, 可以使用该数组访问集合中的项。You can then use the array to access the items that are in the collection. 作为替代方法, 可以使用方法来创建可用于访问集合中的项的枚举器。As an alternative, you can use the method to create an enumerator that can be used to access the items in the collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法将集合的内容复制到数组。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to copy the contents of the collection to an array. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法可确定对象中指定对象的从零开始的索引。 Use the method to determine the zero-based index of the specified object in the object. 如果该节点不在集合中, 则该方法将返回-1。If the node is not in the collection, the method returns -1. > [!NOTE] > 如果指定的对象在集合中多次出现, 则返回第一个匹配项的索引。If the specified object appears multiple times in the collection, the index of the first occurrence is returned.

## Remarks 使用方法将指定 的`index`对象插入到中的对象。 Use the method to insert the specified object into the object at `index`. 作为替代方法, 可以使用方法将对象追加到的末尾。As an alternative, you can append a object to the end of the using the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法以编程方式将新的对象插入到对象中。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to insert a new object programmatically into a object. 若要使此示例正常工作, 必须将位于此部分末尾的 XML 数据复制到名为 books.xml 的文件中。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. remarks.format:
## Remarks 使用索引器 从位于使用数组表示法的对象访问对象。`i` Use the indexer to access a object from the object located at `i` using array notation. 使用索引器可以直接修改或替换集合中的对象。The indexer allows you to modify or replace a object in the collection directly. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用索引器访问对象中的项。The following code example demonstrates how to use the indexer to access the items that are in a object. 第三级节点的对象将用新值以编程方式进行更新。The object for the third-level nodes is updated programmatically with new values. 若要使此示例正常工作, 必须将位于此部分末尾的 XML 数据复制到名为 books.xml 的文件中。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. [!code-aspx-csharp[TreeNodeBindingCollectionIndexer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeBindingCollectionIndexer/CS/treenodebindingcollectionindexercs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeNodeBindingCollectionIndexer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeBindingCollectionIndexer/VB/treenodebindingcollectionindexervb.aspx#1)] 下面是上述代码示例的 XML 数据。The following is the XML data for the preceding code example. ```
```

.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding binding) cil managed

span.span: The to remove.

summary.span: 从 对象中移除指定的 对象。

span.span: Removes the specified object from the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 使用方法从集合中移除指定的对象。 Use the method to remove the specified object from the collection. 然后, 在该节点之后的所有项上移以填充空白位置。All items that follow that node are then moved up to fill the vacant position. 已移动项的索引也会更新。The indexes of the moved items are also updated. 作为替代方法, 可以使用方法移除特定索引处的节点。As an alternative, you can remove a node at a specific index using the method. 你还可以使用方法移除集合中的每个节点。You can also remove every node in the collection using the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法以编程方式从对象中删除对象。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to remove a object programmatically from a object. 若要使此示例正常工作, 必须将位于此部分末尾的 XML 数据复制到名为 books.xml 的文件中。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. [!code-aspx-csharp[TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd/CS/treenodebindingcollectionaddcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd/VB/treenodebindingcollectionaddvb.aspx#1)] 下面是上述代码示例的 XML 数据。The following is the XML data for the preceding code example. ```
```

remarks.format:
## Remarks 使用方法从对象中移除位于处`index`的对象。 Use the method to remove the object located at `index` from a object. 然后, 在该节点之后的所有项上移以填充空白位置。All items that follow that node are then moved up to fill the vacant position. 已移动项的索引也会更新。The indexes of the moved items are also updated. 作为替代方法, 您可以通过使用方法删除特定的对象。As an alternative, you can remove a specific object by using the method. 你还可以使用方法移除集合中的每个节点。You can also remove every node in the collection by using the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法以编程方式从对象中删除对象。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to remove a object programmatically from a object. 若要使此示例正常工作, 必须将位于此部分末尾的 XML 数据复制到名为 books.xml 的文件中。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml.
